metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38161 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper Authentication vulnerability in TLS origin verification of Apache Traffic Server allows for man in the middle attacks. This issue affects Apache Traffic Server 8.0.0 to 8.0.8.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 9.1.3+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 9.1.3+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.3+ds-1').
